newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks close at highest since May 1994.
newsitem.headline: French stocks close at highest since May 1994.

text.p: French shares closed at a fresh high on Friday, taking the blue-chip CAC-40 index to its highest close since May 1994, after a series of U.S. data this week, ending with the trade data on Friday, was well received.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index was up 19.90 points or 0.92 percent at 2,185.23 while the CAC-40 October futures contract was up 23 at 2,190.
On May 18, 1994, the CAC-40 closed at 2,183.99 and it has closed below that level every trading day until today.
The CAC-40 index also hit an intra-day high for the year at 2,187.07. The index gained 1.7 percent compared to last Friday, with falls on Monday and Wednesday.
Dealers said they expected profit taking next week with a support level for the October future contract seen at 2,160.
Volume was 5.8 billion francs of which 4.1 billion in blue-chip shares.
Investors appeared to be reasssured that Thursday's national strike by public sector employees "was no big deal," said a head of equity sales at a French broker.

Danone fell 1.73 percent to 738 francs on disappointment over nine-month sales. Danone said on Thursday after close its nine-month sales were up two percent on a like-for-like basis. Broker Cheuvreux de Virieu lowered its recommendation on Danone to sell from buy.
SGS-Thomson gained 3.32 percent on third quarter results. Morgan Stanley upgraded the share to strong buy from outperform.
